urls.title: Walleys Quarry Landfill Site - Latest Update - Environment Agency - Citizen Space
urls.description: Find and participate in consultations run by the Environment Agency

tweets.text: @MissMaisyDaisy @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe Has someone changed it? Maybe the same person who changed  https://t.co/qjFMtupsVb as it now "minor breach" and not  ‚Äòbreach‚Äô ü§îü§îno note of the correction.Why? Hiding something? Asking for a friend? #stopthestink https://t.co/XPXd0jsoo4

as in the impending closure of Blaydon Quarry landfill. You will see the ‚Äòcompanies‚Äô owning these assets with their tiny balance sheets, no bonds or financial ties go down faster than the Titanic. Forget the next 50 or 60 years of aftercare required, that is going to fall

closed sites. This was driven by landfill tax increasing drive the move out of landfill. At this point - probably 10/15 years ago smaller companies started to acquire full or nearly full landfill. The sellers could not believe they had found a buyer for these potentially toxic
@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids Doesn't exactly instill confidence that the EA are taking the issues concerning Whalleys quarry with any level of seriousness.
@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids Enough is enough, this has gone too far
@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids its bribery, clear as day. RED CEo Been onto them. only explanation!! the dept needs investigating

Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids I‚Äôve just written to the EA with a FOI request about the number of complaints for the last 3 years and the comparison of those figures to other sites in the U.K... I‚Äôm not optimistic that a response will be forthcoming

@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids Are they incompetent? Why has this been changed? Why during the critical incident last week, when they could not handle the numbers of calls...the Monitor was faulty, they couldn‚Äôt send any one, They have excuse after excuse...They are not fit to regulate!!! #stopthestink

@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids Thankyou for investigating, its 00.10, no one can sleep, stench is all through our property & we can't get it out, faces covered in Vick to try to mask smell, it barely does, going to be another long night, not sure how many more of these we can take.

The @EnvAgencyMids have now changed this text to "minor breach" (with no note of correction).

They need to provide urgent clarification as to why, and details of who asked them to make this change.

https://t.co/9vl5xaQgzq https://t.co/Y8O5rAs0qn

@EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @gmb @piersmorgan @joelycett @TheSun @DailyMirror @MirrorPolitics @BBCRadioStoke @bbcmtd @Sotlive  @SOPH_C_ 
@ClareDinnisEA What is going on at the EA? Who asked them to make this change to their press release and why did they? #stopthestink #capitoff https://t.co/nI9NvAZNyS

@EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency Well it stinks again.your incident line is inundated (again) with complaints about Walley‚Äôs Quarry,help your staff out! waiting time 30 minutes. Isn‚Äôt it about time you regulated this site properly? Phil knows @StinkStopthe @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA https://t.co/xAKtnyo7C8
@MissMaisyDaisy @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @StinkStopthe I wonder if the Environment Agency will send anyone out this weekend to gather evidence of the smell?
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 I live in the centre of Newcastle and I've been smelling it since 6.30pm on and off with Windows closed
@Feargal_Sharkey @EcoWomble @ben_watt @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BarnetCouncil @Brent_Council @NaturalEngland https://t.co/9iofUG7ACl

urls.title: Walleys Quarry Landfill Site - Latest Update - Environment Agency - Citizen Space
urls.description: Find and participate in consultations run by the Environment Agency

tweets.text:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüö® WALLEY'S - CONFIRMED BREACH OF SITE PERMIT üö®‚ÄºÔ∏è

The @EnvAgencyMids have confirmed a breach of the site permit. This is very concerning.

Clearly the odour *is* causing annoyance. I will continue to put the pressure on with the EA and at Westminster.

https://t.co/9vl5xaQgzq https://t.co/Cae8tqcrf3

Newly completed #floodplain reconnection project on Dunston Beck, Lincs, turning former arable field into diverse wetland & meadow habitats. #Partnership managed by WTT's Tim Jacklin along with landowners @beeswaxfarming and funding partner @EnvAgencyMids

Now & then shots https://t.co/O8xhJ6pvgK https://t.co/rBoSg6oazw

Absolutely disgusted @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids no investigation, monitoring conveniently not working, lying about nos of complaints. It‚Äôs either corruption or incompetence- which one is it?! #StopTheStink

Latest tree plot we've facilitated in our #Yorkshire village. Not just 3 next to the bench, behind! New shelterbelt to add to sorry remnants; their shape clearly tells tales of prevailing winds! New corridor linking #habitat. Thanks @YorksFarmWild @ProfJGrey #UpperAireProject https://t.co/IO8yDmRV2n

In London! Have no words for my unborn child who will grow up in this! No accountability from the EA and lessons aren‚Äôt being learned here üòû we won‚Äôt be staying in NuL if this is our future...I‚Äôd rather be in London pollution and paying ¬£¬£¬£ #StopTheStink

Latest üì∑ from @LuntMeadows of @VolkerStevinUK work. Great to see access road now ‚Äòtip top‚Äô for public use when open; pumping station working & temporary breach repair complete. #collaboration https://t.co/nrPBqTGC4p

urls.title: Complaints procedure
urls.description: How to make a complaint about the Environment Agency‚Äôs service or appeal against a regulatory decision.

tweets.text: Should local residents wish to make a complaint with regard the failure of the @EnvAgency they can use the following link and procedure below. Residents should also make @StinkStopthe and @DaveJonesNuL aware of the responses you receive. https://t.co/9yOz7jDGtY

The team are still working hard @LuntMeadows to fix the breach in the River Alt, after recent #flooding. 

This week, the helicopter has been installing the 'clay core' which is then compacted by the excavator and added into the existing embankment at either side of the river. https://t.co/saOhv3MZWO

A special meeting of @NewsNBC will take place 18th March to discuss odours / Walleys Quarry Landfill and the poor response of @EnvAgencyMids it will be broadcast live on YouTube. @StinkStopthe üëá https://t.co/xJOb9B5Foc
